item.title: Link: The Future of Computing Performance: Game Over or Next Level?
item.dc:creator: Michael McCracken
item.description:
From the National Academies:

The Future of Computing Performance: Game Over or Next Level?.

A nice, thorough explanation of the current challenges in computing performance, ranging from transistor-level power vs. speed problems, up to how to program the circuits we're likely to end up with.

Also includes a bonus reprint of two classic papers, Gordon Moore's "Cramming More Components onto Integrated Circuits" from 1965 - that's the paper you might expect it is, and Robert Dennard's "Design of Ion-Implanted MOSFETâ€™s with Very Small Physical Dimensions", which I was less familiar with.
